summary: This FBI 302 form documents an interview with a Bureau of Prisons employee (Employee 31) regarding the camera system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) and the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019. The employee describes the outdated and malfunctioning camera system, the specific hardware failures leading up to the incident, and his role in the response and subsequent camera system issues.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC on August 10, 2019; Employee 31 was among personnel who attempted resuscitation.

persons.name: Employee 31
persons.role: Bureau of Prisons Employee / Camera System Manager
persons.context: A BOP employee interviewed by the FBI and SDNY officials; was in charge of all cameras at MCC, described the system's failures, responded to the incident, and handled the DVR hardware afterward.

connections.description: Employee 31 was a BOP staff member at the facility where Epstein was held and was among the personnel who responded to the incident and attempted resuscitation.

events.title: DVR 2 System Failure
events.description: The DVR 2 unit in the MCC camera system experienced a system failure.

events.title: DVR 2 Motherboard Failure
events.description: The motherboard in DVR 2 of the MCC camera system failed.

events.title: Hard Drive Failure and Epstein Incident
events.description: A hard drive in the MCC camera system failed. Later that morning, a body alarm was activated around 6am; Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell. Employee 31 responded and attempted resuscitation.

events.title: FBI Interview of Employee 31
events.description: Employee 31 was interviewed by an Assistant United States Attorney, a Task Force Officer Detective, and an FBI Special Agent at the SDNY USAO regarding the MCC camera system and the Epstein incident.

locations: United States Attorneys Office (USAO), Southern District of New York (SDNY), 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York
keyFacts: The camera system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) was over 20 years old, analog, poorly maintained, and frequently malfunctioned.
At the time of Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, only one hard drive in the camera system was operational due to prior failures of DVR 2 on July 29 and August 8, 2019.
Employee 31 stated that replacing the failed hard drives after the incident would wipe all prior data from the system, and he had advised MCC personnel of this.
An FBI agent, not BOP staff, was the individual who physically removed the DVR unit containing the camera footage after the incident.
